Title: Why Taoists Stand Out ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 20 Explained

Content.Knowledge Point: Taoism teaches following the Tao, not just going with the flow of others.
Content.Text: Taoism is concerned with going along with the flow of the Tao, not necessarily the flow of other people.

Content.Knowledge Point: Taoism's principles often contradict popular opinions.
Content.Text: When a person has dedicated themselves to an honest search for truth, their quest will inevitably lead them contrary to popular opinion from time to time.

Content.Knowledge Point: Taoism does not mean going along with all flows, but choosing the Tao over others.
Content.Text: Taoism teaches mastery of desires, patience, softness, flexibility, other-centeredness, responsiveness to intuition, all of which are completely contrary to the attitudes of the world at large.

Content.Knowledge Point: Following the Tao may set one apart from others, but it's a worthwhile trade.
Content.Text: Although we may have given up the Tao, we still have to follow it. Although we may have given up the chance to be like everyone else, we have given it up in favor of the guidance and companionship of the Tao.
